poem:
**Post-Presidential**

In corridors of empty promises,  
old men swap coherence for echoes.  
A misplaced compliment lingers,  
a haunting whisper in democracy's ear.  
Time turns, their words unravel.  
New faces, the same stage—  
the spotlight fades,  
but the reckoning whispers,  
slow and inevitable,  
in the language of change.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
